description: The Fourth Doctor was portrayed by Tom Baker. He is, to date, the actor who has played the Doctor on television for the longest period of time, having held the role for seven seasons.

episodes.description: The newly regenerated Doctor helps UNIT stop a destructive robot.
The Doctor and his companions arrive on a space station in the future.
The Doctor and his companions encounter a Sontaran on Earth.
The Doctor is sent to Skaro to prevent the creation of the Daleks.
The Doctor faces the Cybermen once again.
The Doctor battles the shape-shifting Zygons.
The Doctor faces a dangerous anti-matter creature.
The Doctor battles the ancient alien Sutekh.

episodes.title: Part Four
episodes.written_by: Stephen Harris (Lewis Greifer and Robert Holmes)

episodes.description: The Doctor uncovers an android plot to invade Earth.
The Doctor confronts a Time Lord scientist gone mad.

episodes.title: Part One
episodes.written_by: Robin Bland (Terrance Dicks and Robert Holmes)

episodes.title: Part Two
episodes.written_by: Robin Bland (Terrance Dicks and Robert Holmes)

episodes.title: Part Four
episodes.written_by: Robin Bland (Terrance Dicks and Robert Holmes)

episodes.description: The Doctor battles a deadly alien plant.
The Doctor encounters the Mandragora Helix.
The Doctor and Sarah Jane Smith discover a fossilized hand that holds a deadly secret.
The Doctor returns to Gallifrey and is framed for the assassination of the Time Lord President.
The Doctor encounters a tribe worshipping a computer as a god.
The Doctor investigates a series of murders on a mining vessel.
The Doctor investigates mysterious happenings in Victorian London.
The Doctor and Leela investigate a mysterious death at a lighthouse.
The Doctor becomes infected with a sentient virus.
The Doctor uncovers an ancient evil on Earth.
The Doctor battles against an oppressive regime on Pluto.
The Doctor and Leela help a group of Minyans in their quest to find the P7E.
The Doctor returns to Gallifrey and becomes President of the Time Lords.

episodes.description: The Doctor and Romana are tasked with finding the first segment of the Key to Time.
The Doctor and Romana visit the planet Zanak, ruled by a tyrannical captain.
The Doctor and Romana investigate mysterious happenings at an ancient stone circle.
The Doctor and Romana seek the fourth segment of the Key to Time on the planet Tara.
The Doctor and Romana seek the fifth segment of the Key to Time on the third moon of Delta Magna.
The Doctor and Romana seek the sixth and final segment of the Key to Time on the planet Atrios.
The Doctor and Romana encounter the Daleks on the planet Skaro.
The Doctor and Romana investigate strange time distortions in Paris.

episodes.title: Part One
episodes.written_by: David Agnew (Douglas Adams, Graham Williams, and David Fisher)

episodes.title: Part Two
episodes.written_by: David Agnew (Douglas Adams, Graham Williams, and David Fisher)

episodes.title: Part Four
episodes.written_by: David Agnew (Douglas Adams, Graham Williams, and David Fisher)

episodes.description: The Doctor and Romana discover a creature imprisoned in a pit on the planet Chloris.
The Doctor investigates drug smuggling on a spaceship.
The Doctor and Romana uncover a labyrinth on the planet Skonnos.
The Doctor and Romana investigate the mysterious planet Shada.
The Doctor and Romana visit the Leisure Hive on the planet Argolis.
The Doctor battles a sentient cactus.
The Doctor and Romana become trapped in E-Space and land on the planet Alzarius.
The Doctor and Romana discover a society ruled by vampires.
The Doctor and Romana try to find a way out of E-Space.
The Doctor and Adric visit Traken, a planet ruled by a benign Keeper.
The Doctor visits the planet Logopolis to repair the TARDIS's chameleon circuit.
